intro: Anemonastrum obtusilobum subsp. nepalense, commonly known as the Himalayan anemone, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its basal leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly rounded leaf lobes and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its ornamental value and ecological significance.
